SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.fhda.argos
Class ArgosV3Report

java.lang.Object
  edu.fhda.argos.ArgosV3Report

public class ArgosV3Report
extends java.lang.Object

The ArgosV3Report class collects all of the necessary elements need to successfully execute a report using Evisions Argos 3.x into one place.

By design, a single API call to the Argos MAPS server will both execute the report, and return the completed result in the request format. This class goes a step further and breaks that process down into two smaller steps. The intent here is specifically to accomodate web applications that implement a dynamic UI with AJAX. If you call the API service directly, you run the risk of the browser making decisions that the user may not appreciate; such as auto-displaying a completed report in the Adobe PDF browser add-on in such a way that the user is re-directed away from your application.

The single service call is also not event based, and in a web application setting, not having events to drive widgets or alerts makes UI design a bit more challenging. Using this class, you can wrap web services around two discreet steps to executing a report: (1) running the actual report to completion, and (2) the downloading of the finished result.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Matt Rapczynski

setReportFormat

public void setReportFormat(java.lang.String format)
Assign a new format to this report object.

Parameters:
format - String describing the format to use. It is recommended that you stick to the pre-defined formats in this class. Argos will reject formats it does not support.

getMAPSReferrer

public java.lang.String getMAPSReferrer()
Get the currently configured HTTP referer URL for the Argos/MAPS Platform server.

Returns:
The current referer URL as a String, or null if unset.

setMAPSReferrer

public void setMAPSReferrer(java.lang.String newRefererURL)
Set the HTTP referer URL for the Argos/MAPS Platform server. See the Argos Report Designers reference, or MAPS Administration reference, for more detail.

Parameters:
newRefererURL - A String representing the referer URL to be used for report execution.

getHTTPResponse

public java.lang.String getHTTPResponse()
Get the response body following the execution of a report. If execution was successful, then typically this will remain blank. If there was an error while trying to run the report, then the information sent back by Argos will be stored here.

Returns:
A String representing the reply from Argos if needed, or null if unused.

getHTTPResponseCode

public int getHTTPResponseCode()
Get the HTTP status/reply code from the last request to the MAPS server from this report reference (could be execution, or downloading).

Returns:
Int value specifying the HTTP status code.

getMAPSReportURL

public java.net.URL getMAPSReportURL()
Get the URL to the completed report following successful execution

Returns:
String value representing the direct download URL to the finished report

addParameter

public void addParameter(java.lang.String variableName,
                         java.lang.String variableValue)
Add parameter/variable to the report to be sent along with the execution request. These variables are to directly correspond with the variables created in the data block. See the "Edit Report", "API" tab for more detail.

Parameters:
variableName - The name of the parameter/variable as a String.
variableValue - The value to assign to the parameter/variable as a String.

removeParameter

public void removeParameter(java.lang.String variableName)
Remove a parameter from the internal variable map used for report execution.

Parameters:
variableName - Name of the variable to remove.

getFinishedReport

public byte[] getFinishedReport()
Get a byte[] array of raw data representing a successfully downloaded report file.

Returns:
Report file as byte[].

getReadTimeout

public int getReadTimeout()
Get the currently configuration network read timeout value in seconds. Defaults to 2 minutes if unchanged.

Returns:
Int value of seconds to wait before timing out.

setReadTimeout

public void setReadTimeout(int readTimeout)
Set a new network read timeout value to override the default. Defaults to 2 minutes if unchanged.

Parameters:
readTimeout - New Int value of seconds to wait for network activity from the MAPS server.

encodeParameters

protected java.lang.String encodeParameters()
                                     throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Build a complete, encoded string of all parameters (including necessary MAPS configuration) to be sent in the request body for report execution. For format details, see reference on MIME type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Returns:
String value representing a complete set of encoded values intended for consumption by the MAPS server
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

executeReport

public void executeReport()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          MAPSException,
                          InvalidReportException
Build an HTTP POST request representing the report to be executed, and send it off to the MAPS server to be filled. Java standard java.net.HTTPURLConnection is used for the network communication.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
MAPSException - If the MAPS returns other than HTTP status 200 or 302.
InvalidReportException - If any problems are identified when validating the report prior to building the HTTP request.

downloadReport

public byte[] downloadReport()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             MAPSException,
                             InvalidReportException
Build an HTTP GET request to fetch the completed report as indicated by the URL returned from MAPS server following successful execution. Java standard java.net.HTTPURLConnection is used for the network communication.

Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException
MAPSException - If the MAPS returns other than HTTP status 200.
InvalidReportException - If it appears that the report was not executed, or had a problem.
